greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Odd-indexed terms of Agoh's congruence A046094: a(n) is conjectured to be 1 iff 2n+1 is prime.
comment: Except for A046094(2) = 1, the even-indexed terms of A046094 are all zero since Bernoulli(2n+1) = 0 for n > 0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: a[ n_ ] := Mod[ Numerator[ -(2 n + 1)* BernoulliB[ 2 n]] * PowerMod[ Denominator[(2 n + 1)* BernoulliB[ 2 n]], -1, 2 n + 1], 2 n + 1]
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 13 2013
